meanings.definition: Caddisflies: aquatic insects with larvae that build protective cases using silk and materials found in their environment.
meanings.sent1: The caddisflies in the stream were busy constructing their silk cases.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of caddisflies near the pond.
meanings.sent3: The caddisflies had a fashion show with their silk cases.
meanings.sent4: The caddisflies' silk homes were like tiny castles in the water.
meanings.sent5: Watching the caddisflies weave their protective cases was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Caddisflies: a type of insect commonly found near bodies of water.
meanings.sent1: Near the lake, we often spot caddisflies fluttering around.
meanings.sent2: The caddisflies by the river were beautiful to watch.
meanings.sent3: The caddisflies held a picnic by the pond.
meanings.sent4: The caddisflies danced in the sunlight like tiny fairies.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering wings of the caddisflies caught my eye near the stream.
